description: Students examine Freud's thesis that our thoughts and actions spring from the darkness of our
unconscious. Because Freud based his theory on a small sample of case studies, the course
scrutinizes this qualitative data and discusses the role of case studies in the study of human
behavior. Students evaluate the criteria for a scientific theory of human behavior and consider
whether Freud's theory meets them.  Offered during Interim. Counts toward German studies
fullname: Freud and the Study of Human Behavior
